THIRTY-MINUTE RECORDINGS
1. KING WITH CROWN. A study of dignity and self-sacrifice.
The story of a slave boy on a slave ship, and the man who helps him.
2. HEARTHFIRE. A study of home and family. The story of a
Tennessee family forced to leave the family homestead when the TVA
constructs Norris Dam.
3. BUILDERS ON THE RIVER. A study of the artisan in our
society. The story of a carpenter in the depression years who built
himself a house.
4. STORY OF A POET. A study of an artist in our society. The
story of Edgar Allan Poe.
5. GRANDFATHER JEFFERSON. A study of a grandfather’s
love for his grandchildren. The story of the latter days of Jefferson.
6. GRENADE. A study of an aspect of basic patriotism. The story
of a Negro soldier in the first World War who has no stock reasons
for fighting.
7. THE ECCENTRIC. A study of the eccentric in our society.
The story of an outspoken philosophy professor.
8. THE RAT ON LINCOLN AVENUE. A study of some atti¬
tudes toward authority. The story of the death of an outlaw.
9. APPOINTMENT AT FORDS. A study of a man’s attitude
toward his destiny. The story of the latter days of Lincoln.
10. DIAL EMERGENCY. A study of neighborliness. The story of a
young lady who must find her brother "somewhere in Maryland,” and
the people who help her.
11. JOHNNY APPLESEED. A study of an individualist. The story
of the pioneer, Johnny Chapman.
12. THE BATTLE. A study of war. The story of a family and the
Battle of New Orleans.
13. THE YANKEE LOVES A LADY. A study of love and duty.
The story of a northern general who falls in love with a southern girl
just after the Civil War.
